author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1687327328}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right handâ€”the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bedâ€”the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198822936011', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1708874705}
review: Poorly made game, very confusing and boring. If your colonized planets get destroyed you can't earn any money so it took me like 5 tries to beat tutorial level. It seems like you can't survive without losing a planet. Also the game is not fullscreen and some mechanics are glitched.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994335129', 'num_games_owned': 1068, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1667515585}
review:
In space no one can hear you scream, but my neighbors still knocked at my door to ask why I was so frustrated.

There are bad games, and then there are things that are not even games. This is not a game. It's an unpolished attempt at a game.

The "game" throws you into space without any information, interface, or training. And then just randomly punishes you with defeat screens, for the most absurd/unforgiving/unfun reasons. There is no learning curve - you hardly get any better by playing it again. There's just guesswork and dumb repetition once you found a strategy that, for some unknown reason, works. Save your time and money and, I don't know, go watch clouds move in the sky, or flowers grow, or ants collect food. All of those activities are more entertaining than this "game"

author: {'steamid': '76561198132503739', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 548, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1614482629}
review:
[b]My playtime:[/b] 3.4h (based on Steam, 14/15 levels completed)

[h1]Intro[/h1]
[b]Forbidden Planet[/b] is a tower defense game in a space setting. You'll mine resources, prevent asteroid attacks, and complete your mission.

[b]Pros:[/b]
- 15 levels to play
- 4 mission types

[b]Cons:[/b]
- Confusing tutorial
- Some visuals stutter when you fast forward in the middle of an attack
- Most levels can be done with the same strategy with a lot of waiting time to finish the level
- Your purchased objects will not show up even though you already spend your money if you fast forward the game
- No map or radar to detect where you are supposed to go
- Most purchasable objects are useless

[h1]Should you buy this game?[/h1]
[b]No.[/b]
[i]I believe there are better tower defense games out there.[/i]

[hr][/hr]
[h1]In-Depth Review[/h1]

[h3]Graphics[/h3]
The game does a good job depicting the game in a space setting. You'll see a machinery-like main ship that is located in the middle of the level, along with planets and asteroids that are scattered around it. I didn't recognize the planets, which might be either because they are made-up planets or uncommon ones. They fit well with the space background though - it's as if they are actual planet images except for the glowing effect and machinery objects that will show up if you build something to it.

The interface is one of the greatest flaws in the game. The fast forward button looks like slapped into the already existing pause button, making them look weird when you see them next to each other. The purchase button is also placed in a very weird spot that you won't be able to tell where it is if you didn't play the tutorial beforehand. The same goes for the purchasing menu - it doesn't look informative unless you know what to do.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2410193626 

[h3]The Game[/h3]
[b]Gameplay[/b]
The gameplay is simpler compared to other tower defense games. You can purchase various objects from the base, whether it's [i]Probe[/i]s for colonizing a planet for its resources, [i]Turrel[/i]s that act as a turret to shoot down meteoroids, or others. The game will revolve around gathering resources from colonized planets and purchasing other objects, mostly [i]Turrel[/i]s, to avoid being destroyed by the meteoroids.

Different missions are available across 15 levels, excluding the tutorial. Most missions are similar, whether it's gathering a certain amount of resources, surviving a certain number of waves, destroying all asteroids, or escorting a spaceship. The latter two might be a bit tricky since you need to travel around with limited resources to finish the missions. However, I found that the escorting mission to be a bit weird since I tend not to see the spaceship when I left it alone, leading me to think that the game was still running even though I failed to protect the ship.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2410194400 

Despite the varying missions, most levels can be done with the same strategy: find a planet to colonize and put some [i]Turrel[/i]s in it. Although you'll be busy setting these up at the beginning, it doesn't take long before it becomes a waiting game - you'll need to fast forward the game and wait for several minutes until the mission objective is completed. To be honest, I failed the level more often because I was either running out of bounds due to my boredom or forgot to buy fuel for my ship rather than failing the mission objective.

Most attacking objects are useless. Although I have been talking about [i]Turrel[/i]s most of the time as a means to attacking, there are other objects that you can purchase. However, they are only temporary, meaning that they will be gone after a few seconds. The expensive price of these items also doesn't help to make them worthwhile, especially since you only need to place 2 [i]Turrel[/i]s on each planet to deal with most asteroids.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2410196326 

[b]Length and Difficulty[/b]
I finished the game at 3.4h. My playtime on Steam is higher than this since I did some idling of the game a few years ago. The difficulty is surprisingly easy once you know what to do except for one level. There is one level where you need to collect a lot of resources within a time limit with only 2 planets to colonize. Since you'll end up having to rely on RNG for this, I didn't bother to finish this level. Some missions such as the escorting missions will require you to think of a strategy to use your resources effectively, but you won't need to think too much compared to other tower defense games.

[b]Problems[/b]
There is no map or radar on screen. You'll spend most of your time locating planets or asteroids because of this. The game also seems not to process my purchase if I bought items with the fast-forward button on. Lastly, although I still could move normally, the visual will stutter sometimes whenever there's a meteoroid attack when I turned the fast-forward button on.

[h3]Specs[/h3]
Intel Core i5-9300H 2.40GHz, 8GB RAM, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650

[h3]Conclusion[/h3]
The game doesn't feel like a tower defense game at all. For one, the difficulty is very easy except for one level that relies on RNG. The confusing tutorial also doesn't help me to understand the game at the beginning, making most of the difficulties that I went through to be spent on learning how the game works. It's not surprising why the game isn't being sold anymore due to the state it's in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015003424', 'num_games_owned': 1489, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1612999724}
review: Forbidden Planet is fun for about 10 minutes, until the clumsy interface begins to irritate and the lack of content starts to show. For a space game, there really isn't anything to explore. So called unexplored planets are right next to the home base and the entire game seems to boil down to colonizing these planets and trying to raise enough money before waves of asteroids arrive and destroy everything. The concept is sound, and it's a shame that the developer didn't pursue this further.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049020554', 'num_games_owned': 4131, 'num_reviews': 374, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1607626093}

Rating: 2.5/10
Recommend Price: $0

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1581932718}
review:
Forbidden Planet is a 2D realtime strategy game where you colonise planets and defend them from waves of attacking asteroids.   The premise is not unreasonable but the implementation falls flat.

Graphics are very poor quality 2D top down style, but at least the developers didn't use pixel graphics.  Gameplay is a little convoluted and not very enjoyable.  The game really lacks polish.  The developers made the right decision by removing this game from sale.   While the developers genuinely seem to have tried here, and they did the right thing by pulling the game, it's still not good enough to recommend to other gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011595325', 'num_games_owned': 2477, 'num_reviews': 929, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1534521332}
review:
Forbidden Planet Ã© um jogo bem regular, mas pelo seu valor ele Ã© bem complexo. Muita gente disse que nÃ£o conseguiu entender, mas nÃ£o Ã© tÃ£o difÃ­cil: vocÃª compra uma sonda, coloniza um planeta, retira recursos dele, compra defesas pra esse planeta e sua base. TambÃ©m Ã© preciso abastecer a nave, dar upgrades nela e por fim resistir a chuva de asteroides (essa parte Ã© o real desafio do jogo, o resto Ã© sÃ³ preparaÃ§Ã£o). Bem tedioso nÃ©? Mas Ã© exatamente o que anunciaram, e tudo funcionou sem bugs aqui. NÃ£o Ã© o meu tipo de jogo, mas da pra perder alguns minutos.
----------------
Forbidden Planet is a fairly regular game, but for its value it is very complex. A lot of people said they could not understand it, but it's not that difficult: you buy a probe, colonize a planet, withdraw resources from it, buy defenses for this planet and your base. It is also necessary to fuel the ship, to upgrades it  and finally to resist the rain of asteroids (this part is the real challenge of the game, the rest is just preparation). Pretty boring right? But that's exactly what they announced, and everything worked without bugs here. It's not my kind of game, but it's good to waste few minutes.

You have a great idea if you buy this game.

I liked this game, and i'm still playing.

You can get the main tacticals quite easily, but your next step is to use that simultenaously.

And improve again and again.

The price is awesome for this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198200148561', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1502631809}
review:
I received this game through a bundle a long time ago and finally got around to trying it out.

The gameplay is incredibly repetitive, with the only objectives being "Survive X asteroid waves" and "Earn X amount of money", with both objectives being completed by playing the game the same way.

It killed about an hour of my time, which honestly wasn't worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1493062935}
review:
Tags: Tower Defense
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content - Remove from library

TLDR: Poorly executed. Easy to upgrade yourself in an unwinnable corner. Constant re-use of assets. Some design in mechanics make no sense because pacing makes them irrelevant.

What might at first seem like an intriguing proposition : Colonize planet, set up shuttle trading network , get cash, put guns around space, ugrade ship, take down asteroids quickly becomes a chore. The same mechanic / map is reused each time with a slightly increasing difficulty in the mission complete objective, not much point in colonize the planets since they get blown to smithereens rather easily, your ship cant shoot so you cant actively defend them, and while you are out collecting ressources you cannot keep an eye on whats going on with your ressource gathering nodes. The asteroids spawn about randomly so you can put yourself in a situation where you didnt keep enough money for refuel after upgrading and cant find an asteroid giving you a game over. It just has so little entertainment value and joy to offer and so much chore and repetition, the game looks underwhelming, with arial font tacked on top of jpeg space. This would had worked better 30 years ago as an atari game or something, and maybe now people would have nostalgia and would want to see it being remade. But as things stand the concept is too primitive to be worth the attention in this day and age

author: {'steamid': '76561198041949592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 605, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1487785932}
review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a game.


[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

All resolution sizes are available.
You can toggle between windowed mode or fullscreen mode.
Nothing else..

[h1]About the game.[/h1]

Soo, your some kind of spaceship thing. You build stuff on planets.. and then you clearly have no idea on what to do. Let alone if you came this far. There is a timer and once this reached 0. Meteors things will be attacking you... You can't defend from your ship... you will have to build defences... But this game is really terrible.. I have no idea why there are soo many bad games released on steam.. Especially like these.


The sound is really bad. It's too loud.
There is a tutorial.. Contains only alot of unappealing text...

[h1]Other things.[/h1]

Made with unity..... Usually says enough.
Just don't get it, Not even for free.

-------------------

I Give this game a 1/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1486941143}
review:
"Forbidden Planet" ist eine Space-Tower-Defence Variante.

Wir steuern aus der Draufsicht ein kleines Raumschiff. Fliegen wir zu Planeten, kÃ¶nnen wir sie kolonisieren, um Rohstoffe abzubauen, die Credits bringen oder etwa eine Verteidigungsanlage in den Orbit zu pflanzen. An unserer heimatlichen Raumstation kÃ¶nnen wir Minen kaufen, mit denen wir dann Asteroiden zerstÃ¶ren kÃ¶nnen oder etwa Turrets, die wir dann beliebig im Raum platzieren kÃ¶nnen oder wir kÃ¶nnen und mÃ¼ssen gelegentlich auch unser Raumschiff nachtanken. In gewissen AbstÃ¤nden kommen dann Wellen von Meteoriten, die dann von den platzierten Verteidigungsanlagen hoffentlich bekÃ¤mpft werden, bevor sie Planeten oder gar unsere Raumstation vernichten kÃ¶nnen.

Ein kaum innovatives, aber dennoch vielversprechendes Konzept fÃ¼r ein Tower-Defence Spiel. Leider hat es aber zu viele Defizite, als daÃŸ es wirklich SpaÃŸ machen wÃ¼rde. DaÃŸ die Aktionsvarianten nicht sehr umfangreich ausfallen lieÃŸe sich noch verschmerzen. Nervig aber, die umstÃ¤ndliche MenÃ¼fÃ¼hrung und das wenig durchdachte Balancing. Auch das unser Schiff stÃ¤ndig Sprit verbraucht, auch wenn es still steht, mag realistisch sein, taktisch verwehrt es einem eine Variante. 

Auch technisch ist das Game schwach. Schon mit der richtigen AuflÃ¶sungsskalierung hat es seine argen Probleme. Grafik und Sound gehen fÃ¼r ein solches Gelegenheitsspiel in Ordnung. DafÃ¼r crasht auch mal das ganze Game.

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
4/10 AtmosphÃ¤re
1/10 Story
4/10 Grafik
4/10 Sound
3/10 Spielmechanik
2/10 Balancing
3/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Unbalanciert und unausgereift.

[h1][b]3/10 Gesamtwertung

author: {'steamid': '76561198333721623', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1476246225}
review:
The Evil Lord has set up a system of defences on the Forbidden Planet, to help him return to power. It is your job to destroy them, skimming the planet's surface and blasting them out. Forbidden Planet is viewed form the cockpit of your craft, with the action displayed in vector graphics. You must shoot out Anti-Aircraft towers and guided missiles for points, while avoiding the damage they can inflict. As well as controls, options include limiting some of the sound effects, and arranging the in-game display in 3 different ways.

Forbidden Planet's a pace racing, addictive game - shame it crashed when I was just beginning to clock up a reasonable score!

author: {'steamid': '76561198154425859', 'num_games_owned': 1242, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1464628337}
review:
[h1]Forbidden is not Always Alluring[/h1]
Really, you don't want to waste your time on this game! Instead of just trashing the unclear directions, bad grammar, elevator music, and general pointless gameplay of the Forbidden Planet; let me give you a list of 18 "better" uses of your time in space, fellow Star Voyager! 

[b]18. Anomaly Series : [/b] Really old school strategy with great artwork

[b]17. Energy Balance: [/b]  Math puzzler in Space with great art

[b]16. Asteroid Bounty Hunter: [/b]   Space Shooter with Beautiful comic book art & good narrative

[b]15. Apollo 4X: [/b]  A very good 4X space game

[b]14. Lunaâ€™s Wandering Stars: [/b]  A planetary physics game 

[b]13. Habitat: [/b]   Sandbox Space Ship Builder using space junk for crafting in actual outer space

[b]12. Universe Sandbox 2â€™ed:[/b]   A Strictly Simulation that lets you imagine â€œWhat if?â€ Great graphics & Art! 

[b]11. Kerbal Space Program: [/b]   Simulates an actual Space Race for all â€˜Kerbal-Kindâ€™ to visit the planets

[b]10. Spore: [/b]  Strictly for building and designing aliens and alien ships (No action/ just art) Also has action gameplay for evolving creatures.

[b]9. Sid Meierâ€™s Starships: [/b]   A 4X game that is at the top of itâ€™s gameâ€¦ using a fleet to conquer the universe 

[b]8. Rymdresa: [/b]   Space story in poetry with awesome graphics & art

[b]7. Rymdkapsel: [/b]  Minimalistic Strategy game that will make you forget why we ever wanted more graphics

[b]6. Planetbase:[/b]   Build & manage a planetary base, with mini colonists to order around & keep alive

[b]5. Empyrion â€“ Galactic Survival: [/b]   Survival Sandbox builder with planet to planet travel & base defense

[b]4. Opus: The Day We Found Earth: [/b]  A Mystery Adventure with excellent narrative & star exploration

[b]3. Offworld Trading Company: [/b]  An Economic Base Builder Simulation with multiple paths to Corporate Success

[b]2. Stellaris: [/b]  Grand Strategy meets 4X in a beautiful new space exploration simulation

[b]1. XCOM: Enemy Unknown/ Enemy Within / XCOM 2: [/b]  The Strategy & 3rdPerson Shooter that lets you rid Earth of aliens with a highly personalizable squad  

[h1]Heed the warning[/h1] & stay away from the â€˜forbidden planet.â€™ You only have so many years on this planet to play video games. Of course, if you just want to spend your money on this to get the cutesy background artâ€¦ there it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995498126', 'num_games_owned': 2373, 'num_reviews': 668, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1462372433}
review:
Ein ordentliches Tower Defense Spiel mit ein klein wenig Action und Planetenmanagement. Mehr nicht.

Ja, es macht schon irgendwie kurzfristig SpaÃŸ. Aber wÃ¼rde es einen gelben Daumen geben, wÃ¤re es angebracht ihn zu geben.
Man bekommt halt ein Spiel, was man fÃ¼r 2 Euro erwarten darf.
Andere Spiele fÃ¼r 5-10 Euro dieser Gattung machen halt deutlich mehr SpaÃŸ.

Die Technik ist grundsolide, basiert auf der Unity Engine. Man kann FullHD anwÃ¤hlen, aber weitere Einstelloptionen sind wie bei den meisten dieser Games dann sehr rar gesÃ¤t.

Die Steuerung des eigenen Raumgleiters ist sehr einfach gehalten. Mehr will man ja auch nicht.
Man fliegt also zum eigenen Planeten, um dort zu tanken, Schiffupgrades zu kaufen, oder aber halt Planetendinge.

In der NÃ¤he befinden sich andere Planeten. Diese kann man besiedeln udn dann auch aufrÃ¼sten. Dadurch bekommt man dann neue Ressourcen. Die Verteidigung ist sehr wichtig, da diese sehr schwache Abwehr haben. Man komtm also nicht drum herum und muss entweder entfernt von der Basis ein schwarzes Loch bauen, was Asteroiden verschlingt, oder aber Schutzschilde fÃ¼r die Planeten kaufen.
Das ist alles teuer und leider nur zeitlich begrenzt, spÃ¤testens zur nÃ¤chsten Welle mus sman wieder genug Geld fÃ¼r solche Dinge gesammelt haben.

Man kann noch herumstehende dicke Felsbrocken im All mit Minen zerstÃ¶ren, darin befinden sich entweder Credits oder Benzin. Wirklich spaÃŸig und nÃ¼tzlich ist das jedoch nicht udn dient eher als Zeitvertreib zwischen den einzelnen Wellen, wenn man eh mal wieder kein Geld hat oder bereits die wenigen mÃ¶glichen Dinge erledigt hat.

Der Einstieg isn Spiel fiel mir relativ schwer, da ich trotz eines Tutorials doch ziemlich blÃ¶d gleich im zweiten level krepiert bin, weil ich entweder meine Planeten verloren habe, oder aber ohne Benzin verreckt bin.
Man benÃ¶tigt also vielleicht ein paar AnlÃ¤ufe, ehe man sich so einen optimalen Start fÃ¼r schnelle Credits und Verteidigung zurecht gelegt hat.
Wenn man das Spiel bis dahin noch nicht gelÃ¶scht hat, macht es sogar ein wenig SpaÃŸ, auch wenn der Spielinhalt doch eher dÃ¼rftig ist.

Der Sound ist wirklich nett und man hÃ¶rt ganz gerne hin, wenn einem zwischen den Wellen ein wenig langweilig wird. Eine Vorspultaste ist vorhanden.

Was ich ein wenig blÃ¶d finde, ist, dass ich irgendwie keine Ãœbersichtskarte gefunden habe, die man aktivieren kann.
Man fliegt da also rum und muss sich einprÃ¤gen, wo die eigenen Planeten sind.
Ok, die sind ganz in der NÃ¤he, aber ich habe es schon mehrmals gehabt, dass diese dann nach einer Minute schon weggebombt waren, als ich diese gesucht habe.
Auch sind die anfliegenden kleinen FelskÃ¶del viel zu klein geraten, man sieht die kaum.
Ich habe jetzt erst 5-6 Level gespielt.
Aber wenn ich mir das ein wenig hochrechne, dann wird das Spiel in weiteren Levels ziemlich hektisch udn unÃ¼bersichtlich werden.
Man wird also dann zu Beginn der nÃ¤chsten Welle irgendwo ein schwarzes Loch hinsetzen mÃ¼ssen, um dann anschlieÃŸend zu den bedrohten, weil fast weggebombten, Planeten hinzuflitzen, um dort dann ggf. Schutzschilde draufzusetzen.

Also, wie gesagt, ich finde dieses Spiel durchschnittlich.
FÃ¼r den gÃ¼nstigen Preis kann man sich es ja mal anschauen.
SpielspaÃŸ wird sich aber erst nach ein paar Levels einstellen, wenn man den Dreh raus hat und man mehr zu tun bekommt.
Ob sich langanhaltende Spielfreude einstellen kann, muss jeder fÃ¼r sich selbst entscheiden.
Ich persÃ¶nlich finde klassische TD Spiele wesentlich interessanter, werde diesem Spiel jedoch noch die eine oder andere Chance nach dem Feierabend geben.

Meine SpielspaÃŸwertung: 6 / 10 (ausreichend bis befriedigend)


UPDATE:
So, ich habe die Kampagne mit ca. 10 Missionen durch. Es gibt noch ein paar Zusatzmissionen.
In ein paar Missionen muss man lediglich Geld ansparen oder aber in einer vorgegebenen Zeit Asteroiden zerbomben. Ersteres ist eine willkommene Abwechslung, Letzteres langweilig.
Ansonsten mus sman in den normalen Missionen lediglich dafÃ¼r sorgen, dass die nÃ¤chstgelegenen Planeten Ã¼berleben, damit man genÃ¼gend Geld ansammeln kann, um dann bei jedem Angriff der Reihe nach 1 oder 2 dieser schwarzen LÃ¶cher (Voids) weit weg von der Basis plazieren kann.
Dann hat man quasi schon gewonnen. Je weiter das entfernt gesetzt ist, desto eher fliegen alle Asteroiden an einem vorbei.
Somit habe ich das Spiel quasi ganz leicht gewonnen, lediglich einmal bin ich noch in der letzten Mission abgekackt, nur weil meine dÃ¤mliche Benzinwarnmeldung viel zu spÃ¤t kam und mein Antrieb wieder einmal verreckt ist und ich deswegen neu starten durfte.
Bis jetzt habe ich noch nicht herausgefunden, ob udn wie man schieÃŸen kann.
Vermutlich wird das aber in einer Zusatzmission benÃ¶tigt, da ich im Weltraum ein Forschungsschiff beschÃ¼tzen soll. Keine Ahnung.
Auch wofÃ¼r dieses Utilizator Schiff fÃ¼r 10K Gold benÃ¶tigt werden kÃ¶nnte, das hat sich mir im Spiel nicht erschlossen.
Aber wie gesagt: naheliegende Planeten erschlieÃŸen, Transportschiffe bauen, GeschÃ¼tz bauen, 1-2 Voids pro Angriffswelle kaufen, schon gewonnen. :-)

Fazit:

3-4 Stunden einigermaÃŸen SpaÃŸ fÃ¼r Zwischendurch. Mehr nicht. Wertung auf 6/10 angehoben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173683283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1464528235}
review:
Badly balanced game. The only strategy that works is to reinforce a single planet, and hope that teh other planets don't get hit. If you try and protect other planets, then the game becomes impossible as resources are spread too thinly. 

The developer needs to make the resource acquisition rate higher, that way it's possible to defend more than one planet.

In summary you can win at this game, but it has little to do with strategy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111968405', 'num_games_owned': 2283, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1457920232}
review:
Forbidden Planet is sci-fi rogue-like strategy tower defense, which is awesome for casual playing.
I found it most enjoying playin every morning with first coffe 30ish minutes.

Graphic is decent, music is enjoyable, and gameplay provides enough fun with not to get borring any time soon.

In Forbidden Planet your main goal is to protect your home planet, and at the same time colonize and harvest other.

Overall, it is cheap and fun little game, definitely worth keeping eye on it, however only thing I dont like is that there is too much damn asteroids ^^

review:
Thanks Zem for the key.

 Me ha gustado mucho este juego. Es una mezcla de: "Colonization","Faster Than Light", y "Asteroids"

Una vez pasado el prÃ³logo en el cuÃ¡l te enseÃ±as como manejar tu nave, y equiparla. Te dispones a conquistar tu primer planeta. Con lo cuÃ¡l habrÃ¡s comprado en la tienda de tu planeta origen, una sonda, o varias...
 Una vez colonizado tu planeta destino, tendrÃ¡s que protegerlo contra las adversidades del espacio exterior, y si has seguido correctamente el tutorial, te habrÃ¡s provisto de metodos defensivos, para poder protegerlo, y que posteriormente, te proveea de recursos.

 ImportantÃ­simo en este juego es la gasolina, no te puedes quedar sin ella. Ya que tu partida se acabarÃ¡ en ese mismo instante.
 Mientras tu ya planeta colonizado, y sumistrandote recursos, el juego te ofrecera retos, los cuales una vez cumplidos, te proveeran de mejoras para tu nave y metodos mejores de defensa, en los siguientes planetas colonizables. AdemÃ¡s de poder pasear por el espacio (recuerda el combustible) buscando, recuersos aislados, o destruyendo asteroides perdidos por el espacio. Que tambiÃ©n te proporcionan recursos. Ten cuidado con las minas, vigila su radio de acciÃ³n, si no tambiÃ©n perderÃ¡s tu nave, y la partida.

Juego totalmente recomendable


ala hasta luego

author: {'steamid': '76561198012545565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1491988705}
review:
Stay away from this garbage!

The tute say to try to find something, I forget what. 
The main problem I had was that you could not actually do anything once you actually get control of the game. Clicking on things did NOTHING. There is a thing lower right that if you click on it, it opens a selection of non-selectable things, which is rather pointless.

Garbage, absolute garbage. Even if you manage to build a turret, whilst you are trying to figure out what it is you are supposed to be doing during the tute, you will get a message about low fuel warning, then the tute will simply end with your defeat!

Idiot game developers!
